cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and meander near or just inland of the coast through the weekend before wobbling back offshore early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch south of Mouth of Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from north of Sargent to High Island, TX; Storm Surge Warning from Port Mansfield to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely; brief gusts near hurricane force possible. 50-kt wind probability peaks at 21%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground level possible along Galveston Island and the west shore of Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches with isolated 35 inches possible, leading to catastrophic flooding in the Galveston/Houston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged port access restrictions due to flooding.
